name: Club Quarters World Trade Center

reviews.text: Probably one of the bigger hotels I've stayed in while in NYC. Easy to check in and out with the computers and convenient to the subway which is a plus. If you're catholic, 4 pm mass at St Peter's about a 10 min walk away on Saturdays. Staff was friendly, free water on the floors which is a plus. Lots to do within walking distance
reviews.title: NYC

reviews.text: Downside is the construction going on, but wasn't in my room when they were doing anything to really care about it. Since you are at Ground Zero, you have the tour groups going around so that adds to the already congested NYC sidewalks but that's something the hotel has no control over.
reviews.title: Always great, but not this time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has always been my first choice, but since my latest stay I'll have to think twice. Due to poor maintenance I had to change rooms twice. On the first room the temperature control was not working. On the second room the TV was broken, which was acceptable for the first night. I complained to guest services, but they did nothing. At night the technician came in and suggested I changed rooms. By the way, temperature control was also broken.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Right now I'm moving to the third room. Let's see how it goes.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked through a third party and got a good deal.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, clean and well located hotel

reviews.text: I try to book lower Manhattan as much as possible do this is my area. I really enjoyed this hotel. I booked a one room suite and got moved to the World Center - which means I had to walk through a door when I got off the elevators. My friands who booked this hotel stayed on the Club Quarters side in a standard room. These hotels are the same. They have the same amenities etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Same as World Ceneter Hotel

reviews.text: Location: Great
reviews.title: Great option for the price point

reviews.text: Service: Good - Bellmen lost the luggage cart and had not found it by checkout. No real motivation to assist guests. Yes and no Answers and no I'll get that fixed for you attitude.
reviews.title: Good hotel but lots of walking for main sight seeing

reviews.text: General Upkeep - Good. Rooms were in good shape and fairly new. The coffe machine in lobby was broken for two days. The free newspapers that are advertised were not in the lobby due to construction.
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay for a quick trip

reviews.text: Cleanliness - Great - no issues.
reviews.title: Got what it needs for business traveller

reviews.text: We arrive on the 22 of Dec.make my reservation for 3 people me and my wife the queen bed our daugther (22) got a pull out chair not so confortable, eventhought the hotel was almost empty, i ask for a larger room but did not get it.the hotel has a large area for costumers downstairs coffee and tea all the time!!! free wi-fi!!! and a very secure area been close to 911 memorial, very close to almost every line on subway!!! great prices!!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, So So Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, yes the restaurant was not top notch, but you cannot blame the location. Right beside ground zero and close to many good places such as battery park, the holocaust museum and the tube.
reviews.title: In the heart of the financial city at a good price

reviews.text: + Friendly staff
reviews.title: Great for a long stay

reviews.text: + Pretty good room, although try to get a room with windows towards ground zero.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.text: + Fantastic location
reviews.title: Suite not available. Neglected to give package then sent 2-day air sticking me with the FEDEX charges!

reviews.text: Comfortable and clean hotel in the hart of Manhattan. Its roof terrace gives you an amazing view on ground zero and Liberty Tower. Too bad the restaurant only offers a limited menu, otherwise it would be an absolute top dining experience.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a short business trip. The rooms were quiet and bed comfortable, the restaurant upstairs has great view of the ground zero. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The business center at the entrance is useful.They have free water on all floors which is cool. The only problem was there was some kind of damp smell coming from the bathroom.If you have business in the financial district area would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: for business trip

reviews.text: The hotel is situated right opposite the rebuilding of the world trade center so some noise and mess.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but small rooms for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard rooms are very small for the money,we upgraded for $25 a night and was worth it got great view of the 9/11 memorial.The big downside for me was the fact the hotel will not call you a cab so you have to carry all your luggage around the block and wait ages for a cab,and this is why i wouldn't stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location, very affordable

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here the weekend of Oct. 26th. It was our 10 year anniversary and we were pleasently surprised. The thing that we liked the most was the feeling of safety all around the hotel, with so many police at every corner for the WTC memorial. It was also very clean and modern. We will be coming back next year and bringing the kids with us. I would highly recommend this Hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Great location, Great view, Great value

aka: Club Quarters World Trade Hotel New York City
description: Private, full service club-like hotel with 252 rooms located on the south side of the World Trade Center with unfettered views of what will become the United States’ most famous landmark. In the heart of downtown Manhattan, nearby neighborhoods include Tribeca, Soho, Battery Park, South Street Seaport, Wall Street and Chinatown and close to dining, shopping and entertainment. Club Quarters is the best value hotel based on quality and the prime location.Club Quarters provide:• Safe, restricted entry• Instant registration and check out• Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel• Onsite restaurant • Multi-menu in room dining options (through onsite restaurant and many local restaurants)• Fridge and microwave available• Unlimited complimentary chilled purified bottled water • 3 meeting and event rooms available (maximum reception style 100 people)• Free use of computer/printer • Ergonomic workstations• State of the art guest rooms with premium bedding• Contemporary furnishings• Flat panel HD TVs• Complimentary coffee and tea• 24 hour guest service desk • Fitness room • Exercise equipment delivered to guest room upon request • Corporate Apartments available • Value rates• Government per diem rates 365 day a year with valid ID• Laundry facilities.
